abstracts.cdata!:
The Bahia sustainable rural development
            project of Brazil has as its main aim to promote the
            socioeconomic development of the state, particularly the
            rural environment with a focus on family farming,
            agro-ecology, food and water security, and their required
            complements: socio-productive infrastructure and market
            access. It is expected that with the actions to be
            implemented by the Sustainable Rural Development Project,
            the State of Bahia can more rapidly improve the quality of
            life of the poorest municipalities and, consequently the
            state. The proposed project interventions will be
            small-scale, demand-driven investments (i.e., subprojects).
            These subprojects will not cause significant adverse
            environmental impacts, related mainly to infrastructure
            development (i.e., water, sanitation and rural roads), new
            agricultural practices (i.e., product diversification,
            conservation agriculture, promotion of value added products,
            and product certification). The project will also provide
            guidance on: (i) identifying the potential social,
            environmental and distributive impacts associated with the
            typology of project investments; (ii) minimizing potential
            impacts for productive and infrastructure subprojects; (iii)
            specifying procedures to be used in assessing environmental
            and social impacts during the subproject design stage; and
            (iv) addressing identified impacts during subproject implementation.
